definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: In 2013, Barton felt the itch to get back to work.
sentences.chinese: 到了2013年，他又覺得手癢，想重返工作崗位。

sentences.english: Well, me hearties, it's just itchin' for a remake.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，我的朋友，這不過是一時手癢要重拍而已。

sentences.english: After hibernating for months, they are itching for action.
sentences.chinese: 在冬眠了幾個月之後，他們開始手癢想行動。

sentences.english: My fingers itch to box his ears.
sentences.chinese: 是手癢得想打他一個耳光。

sentences.english: As long for the wife lord lets the time of matchless hand Yang go to wager up several pair ofs liked.
sentences.chinese: 只要妻主讓無雙手癢的時候去賭上幾把就好了。

sentences.english: One's fingers itch to do sth.

definition: to be an irksome presence (i.e. sth or sb one wishes were not there)
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense

(TV or movie) blooper/continuity error/(theater) to flub one's lines/unintended exposure of a body part/to be exposed (of a scheme or trick)/to reveal sth one intended to conceal through a slip of the tongue/to blow one's cover
to be an eyesore/(fig.) to spoil the fun/to be a wet blanket
